project_summary: Utilizing the YOLOv8 model for the detection and classification of bird species, targeting a diverse range of 524 species included in the training dataset. The finalized model achieves an accuracy of > 98% on the test dataset.

The classic game of Hangman was developed with a graphical user interface (GUI) using Pygame, and character names from Harry Potter were used as word data, which were retrieved using BeautifulSoup. Idea for GUI is from TechwithTim.

Using a customized MobileNet model for the classification of 524 bird species in the training dataset. This model was fine-tuned to accurately recognize and differentiate each species, achieving a high accuracy of over 98% on the test dataset.

project_title: Bird classification using 2 different models: the YOLOv8 and MobileNet architectures
project_summary: This project integrates two models: a customization of MobileNet architecture (Howard, A.G., et al., 2017) and a model based on the You Only Look Once (YOLO) framework (Redmon, J. et al., 2016). Each model achieves the accuracy of > 98% on the test dataset.

This repository offers source code for a bird classification model that can identify 524 species. It was designed for efficiently testing various model architectures, including: InceptionV3, MobileNetV1, MobileNetV2 and YOLOv8.

project_title: Mitochondria instance segmentation research using Detectron2
project_summary: This repository hosts the source code for an instance segmentation project, focusing on segmenting mitochondria in microscopic images. Detectron2 (Wu et al., 2019) was utilized as the primary tool for this task.

project_title: Mitochondria instance segmentation research using YOLOv8
project_summary: This repository contains the source code for an instance segmentation project, focusing on segmenting mitochondria in microscopic images. The architecture of You Only Look Once framework (i.e., YOLOv8 ) was utilized as the main tool for this task.

project_title: Mitochondria instance segmentation web application using YOLOv8
project_summary: This repository hosts the source code for a web application designed for instance segmentation tasks. It detects and segments mitochondria in microscopy images. The core of this application applied the architecture of the You Only Look Once framework (i.e., YOLOv8).

project_title: Mitochondria instance segmentation web application using Detectron2
project_summary: This repository hosts the source code for a web application designed for instance segmentation tasks. It detects and segments mitochondria in microscopy images. Detectron2 (Wu et al., 2019) was utilized as the primary tool for this task.

project_title: Mitochondria instance segmentation web application using Detectron2 and YOLOv8 for better comparison
project_summary: This repository hosts the source code for a web application designed for instance segmentation tasks. It detects and segments mitochondria in microscopy images. Two architectures, Detectron2 (Wu et al., 2019) and You Only Look Once (i.e., YOLOv8) were utilized in this task for better model comparison.

The development of a 2-layer neural network (NN) only using NumPy. This project is a practical introduction to the fundamentals of deep learning and neural network architecture. The main focus will be on the step-by-step construction of the network, aiming to provide a clear and straightforward understanding of its underlying mechanics (i.e., the mathematics behind NNs).

project_title: Using AWS SageMaker to construct a Neural Network from scratch
project_summary: This repository provides the development of a 3-layer Neural Network (NN) from sratch (i.e., only using Numpy) for solving the binary MNIST dataset. This project offers a practical guide to the foundational aspects of deep learning and the architecture of neural networks. It primarily concentrates on building the network from the ground up (i.e., the mathematics running underthe hood of NNs).
